etymology.description: Depicts a container -> borrowed phonetically for the plant name
etymology.interpretation: Originally depicted a container, 豆(豆) (dòu, 'drum') was phonetically borrowed to represent the plant name for beans, eventually displacing the term 菽(菽) (shū, 'pulse'). It is unrelated to the 豊(豊) (fēng, 'abundant') character.

examples.chinese: 祭司敲豆奏乐(祭司敲豆奏樂)，引来神灵祝福(引來神靈祝福)。
examples.pinyin: Jìsī qiāo dòu zòuyuè, yǐn lái shénlíng zhùfú.
examples.english: The priest beats the drum, summoning divine blessings.

examples.chinese: 古风庆典上敲响豆(古風慶典上敲響豆)，唤起怀古情怀(喚起懷古情懷)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔfēng qìngdiǎn shàng qiāoxiǎng dòu, huànqǐ huáigǔ qínghuái.
examples.english: At the ancient-style celebration, the beating of the drum evokes nostalgic sentiments.
The sound of the drum shakes the heavens.
